results.title: The Care of the aged
results.brief_description: The problems of old people who have lived through two world wars, are often passed over by an industrial society. How do they live? Germany attempts to improve their lives by providing homes, entertainment, and other social services.

results.title: The Care behind the smile
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services, Suzanne Baker and Debby Kingsland
results.brief_description: Dental therapists are badly needed in schools to ensure bad tooth decay does not develop amongst children. The film tells of the Australia-wide dental therapist training scheme, which will provide dental therapists for schools.

results.title: The Cardioid
results.brief_description: Illustrates the properties of the cardioid which are connected with the generation as a one-cusped epicycloid. In five parts, it deals with he double generation of the cardioid, the tangents, the normals, the evolute, and a recapitulation of these aspects. Curves mechanically drawn by Jack Peskett.

results.title: The Card
results.creator_credit: British Film-Makers Limited, John Bryan and Ronald Neame
results.brief_description: Edward Henry Machin (Alec Guinness), Denry for short, has been determined from youth to master his own fate. He uses his powers of persuasion and deception to cajole his way to fame and fortune, but still manages to remain friends with everyone. Affectionately known as ‘The Card’, Denry’s ultimate coup occurs when he becomes the youngest mayor of his home town of Bursley. Denry is not without female companionship, and his life is influenced by three women; a Countess, a dancing teacher, and the councillor’s daughter. It is through his relationship with these women that his deceptive ways are exposed. Also starring Glynis Johns, Valerie Hobson and Petula Clark. Based on the novel by Arnold Bennett and screenplay by Eric Ambler. Also known as “The Promoter”.

results.title: The car body: materials and design
results.brief_description: Summary: three alternative materials to steel for car bodies are highlighted. fully functional cars which have been made in glass reinforced plastic, wood and plastic are shown and their designers justify the use of these materials. there is a discussion

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Captive = La Captive
results.creator_credit: Gemini Films, Chantal Akerman, Arte France and Paolo Branco
results.brief_description: Chantal Akerman, one of contemporary cinema’s singular filmmakers, is the director of “La Captive”, a minimalist masterpiece about the complexities and ‘politics’ of male-female relations. Inspired by Marcel Proust’s “The Prisoner” (the fifth volume of “Remembrance of Things Past”), “La Captive” centres on Simon (Stanislas Merhar), a handsome, wealthy, young man, who lives in an opulent multi-levelled apartment with his grandmother, a maid, and Ariane (Sylvie Testud), his girlfriend and willing ‘captive’. We first see Simon stalking Ariane as she runs an errand, it gradually becomes apparent that he is compelled to control her every movement, to the point where he forcibly removes her from social gatherings and orders her how to bathe and when to join him in bed. Inflaming Simon’s suspicion and anxiety is Ariane’s close connection to a circle of women friends, especially, the beautiful, Andree (Olivia Bonamy), with whom she spends a lot of time. Increasingly distressed, Simon decides to terminate their relationship and drives Ariane to a grand seaside hotel for a final, tragic night together. Exactly why Ariane submits to Simon’s control remains largely unexplained. True to Akerman’s abstract, minimalist style, such ‘story’ details or emotional content are kept at bay to enable a more philosophical exploration of ideas of obsession, male-female vs. female-female relations, and the relation between control and desire. Akerman expertly fine-tunes story tension via rhythm, shot composition and her signature austere, elegant style. With more then a hint of Hitchcock’s “Vertigo”, Bresson’s “Une Femme Douce”, and Antonioni’s “L’Avenntura”, “La Captive” is a seminal film that questions the very possibility of an open and humane relationship between a man and woman. Beautifully shot by Sabine Lancelin and impeccably scored. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Canterville ghost
results.brief_description: A delightful animated adaptation of a tale by Oscar Wilde, it tells the story of a ghost who tries to scare the new inhabitants from his house. Instead of being scared, the Otis family find the ghost’s ghoulish games quite entertaining. The ghost becomes quite discouraged until the family’s caring daughter, Virginia, takes the time to discover the reasons for his hauntings.
